interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: 4 Film Favorites: Nightmare on Elm Street 1-4 (A Nightmare on Elm Street, Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddie's Revenge, Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors, Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master)
Review Date: 2019/07/12
Store: Robert Englund  (Actor),     Johnny Depp  (Actor),     Wes Craven  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Horror
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Titles include: A Nightmare On Elmstreet, A Nightmare On Elmstreet 2: Freddy's Revenge, A Nightmare On Elmstreet 3: Dream Warriors, A Nightmare On Elmstreet 4: The Dream Master", 'Amazon.com', "In the trinity of modern horror films, there's the father (Michael Myers of Halloween), the son (Jason of Friday the13th fame, a knockoff), and the unholy spirit, Freddy Krueger of the Nightmare on Elm Street films. The spectral man who haunted the nightmares of unsuspecting teenagers with deadly consequences, Freddy (as played by Robert Englund) was a truly frightening bogeyman and icon for the '80s. Unlike the hockey-masked Jason, who dispatched horny teenagers with mechanical and monotonous ease (he never talked, never took off his mask), Freddy was a truly creative and diabolical villain, with a sadistic and blackly funny personality. The hallmarks of the Nightmare on Elm Street series were imaginatively gruesome suspense pieces, set in the overactive imaginations of the teen victims. The first film of the series, Wes Craven's truly intelligent and scary film, was so hugely successful it begat not one, not two, but six more sequels, each pretty much diluting the originality and horror of its predecesor. (Horror fans will fondly remember Drew Barrymore's assertion in Scream that the first Nightmare film was great but all the rest sucked.) Still, there's fun to be had in the remaining films in the series, seeing as a number of aspiring filmmakers cut their teeth on the continuing saga of Freddy. Frank Darabont (The Shawshank Redemption) and Chuck Russell (The Mask) worked on the third installment, Dream Warriors (starring a young Patricia Arquette), and Renny Harlin (Die Hard 2) came to prominence with the ingeniously macabre fourth film, The Dream Master, coscripted by Brian Helgeland (L.A. Confidential). Craven and original star Heather Langenkamp did return for the last film, New Nightmare, which presaged the tongue-in-cheek postmodernism of the Scream films and resharpened Freddy's ability to scare. --Mark Englehart"]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Box set', 'Contributor': 'Patricia Arquette, Wes Craven, Johnny Depp, Kim Myers, Ken Sagoes, Tuesday Knight, Robert Englund, Mark PattonPatricia Arquette, Wes Craven, Johnny Depp, Kim Myers, Ken Sagoes, Tuesday Knight, Robert Englund, Mark Patton   See more', 'Initial release date': '2008-10-14', 'Language': 'English', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1, 1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.39 x 7.48 x 0.63 inches; 3.03 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'WARD042244D', 'Director': 'Wes Craven', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Box set', 'Run time': '6 hours and 14 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 14, 2008', 'Actors': 'Robert Englund, Johnny Depp, Patricia Arquette, Mark Patton, Kim Myers', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Collecting the entire Nightmare series and this was an inexpensive way to begin.
Review Title: 4 movies for one price!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Electric Horseman
Robert Redford  (Actor),     Jane Fonda  (Actor),     Sydney Pollack  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Robert Redford plays an ex-world champion cowboy, reduced to huckstering breakfast food in a suit studded with flashing lights. Jane Fonda is a chic, sharp member of the electronic media, a TV newswoman who'll do anything to get a good story. When Redford rides out of a Las Vegas casino into the desert astride his sponsor's living symbol, a multi-million dollar racehorse, Jane is determined to discover why. She does, one step ahead of a posse of pursuing police. But by the time they reach a remote rendezvous high in the Utah mountains, she is in love with both the cowboy and his convictions.Bonus Content:", 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Recommendations', 'Recommendations']

Perfect feel-good movie. Redford and Fonda have amazing chemistry. Beautiful scenery as they journey to free the horse. You won't be disappointed.
Great!
Child's Play [DVD]
Catherine Hicks  (Actor),     Chris Sarandon  (Actor),     Tom Holland  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles
['The "chills come thick and fast" (Los Angeles Times) as voodoo and terror meet within an innocent-looking doll inhabited by the soul of a serial killer who isn\'t ready to die. From the Director of Fright Night comes a "clever, playful" (The New York Times) and stylish thriller with "excellent special effects" (Leonard Maltin) and heart-pounding suspense guaranteed to scare! After 6-year-old Andy Barclay\'s (Alex Vincent) babysitter is violently pushed out of a window to her death, nobody believes him when he says that "Chucky," his new birthday doll, did it! Untilthings start going terribly wrong dead wrong. And when an ensuing rampage of gruesome murders lead a detective (Chris Sarandon) back to the same toy, he discovers that the real terror has just begun\'the deranged doll has plans to transfer his evil spirit into a living human beingyoung Andy!']
{'Genre': 'Mystery & Thrillers', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, DVD, NTSC, Color, Full Screen', 'Contributor': 'Brad Dourif, Raymond Oliver, Alex Vincent, Juan Ramrez, Alan Wilder, Dinah Manoff, Chris Sarandon, Tommy Swerdlow, Catherine Hicks, John Lafia, Jack Colvin, Tom Holland, Richard Baird, Don Mancini, Neil GiuntoliBrad Dourif, Raymond Oliver, Alex Vincent, Juan Ramrez, Alan Wilder, Dinah Manoff, Chris Sarandon, Tommy Swerdlow, Catherine Hicks, John Lafia, Jack Colvin, Tom Holland, Richard Baird, Don Mancini, Neil Giuntoli  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Tom Holland', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, DVD, NTSC, Color, Full Screen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 28, 1999', 'Actors': 'Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent, Brad Dourif, Dinah Manoff', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Don Mancini, John Lafia, Tom Holland', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Kind of confused because I ordered the movie Child's Play, but received it as part of a three part movie disc with Amityville Horror and Carrie. I guess it was ok, but I only wanted Child's Play. So, not sure what anyone else will get.
You get the movie, but.........

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** Enjoys feel-good movies across action, adventure, and drama genres, while also embracing a growing interest in horror and suspense narratives, particularly those that are iconic and influential.
- **Actor Affinity:** Prefers films featuring iconic actors like Robert Redford and Jane Fonda, along with a notable interest in talents associated with the horror genre such as Robert Englund and Johnny Depp.
- **Themes:** Enjoys narratives that explore personal convictions and the human-animal bond while increasingly delving into horror themes, demonstrating an openness to darker storytelling.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Seeks uplifting entertainment but is increasingly drawn to suspenseful films. The user has rated a horror film highly, indicating a positive engagement with this genre.
- **Viewing Format:** Continues to favor physical media formats, particularly DVD, illustrating a traditional approach to movie-watching.
- **Visual Aesthetics:** Values beautiful cinematography and scenic settings, which are integral to both uplifting and thrilling films.

Overall, the user displays a refined taste for character-driven stories with strong performances that resonate emotionally and visually while actively expanding their exploration of horror and suspense, enhancing their overall viewing experience.
